data.title: Lady Brabourne College – Kolkata – Leading Women's College in Kolkata

College Overview!

Lady Brabourne College, with its lush green lawns and gardens opposite the Park Circus Maidan is one of the premier Institutions for women's education in India. Established by the Government of Bengal in July 1939 and named after the wife of Lord Brabourne, the Governor of Bengal till February 1939, the college made a humble beginning with 35 Muslim students and 9 faculty members in a rented house in Park Circus. The foundation stone of the building in which it is presently housed was laid on 26th August 1939 by Sir J. Woodhead the then Governor of Bengal. Ever since the college has expanded structurally and academically earning the reputation of having an excellent academic environment.

From The Principal's Desk

Our college was founded in 1939 with quite a noble mission of educating and enriching poor Muslim girls, enlightening and emancipating them. Gradually it has emerged as a multi-cultural institute for students from varied backgrounds. It has in the mean time put on a number of feathers on its hat.

I wholeheartedly believe that two most important factors behind the all-round development and success of this College are:

(a) a long tradition of a very strict discipline and

(b) a total absence of any kind of external interference. This is probably reflected in the consistently brilliant academic performance of our students both during and after their College days.

Our College has now completed 80 glorious years. I am quite certain, you will all extend your good wishes to make this journey much smoother, to make our College more beautiful in every respect and to help our College reach its zenith.

PRINCIPAL

Professor Siuli Sarkar,

M.A., Ph.D (Calcutta University)

Admission 2024-25

CALL FOR PAPERS FOR IQAC JOURNAL OF HUMANITIES 2024

IQAC Lady Brabourne College intends to publish a new volume of ISSN Journal of Humanities in 2024. The Journal of Humanities is open to quality original research-based articles/papers in Sanskrit, Bengali, Hindi, English, Persian and Urdu from Faculty of Arts of Lady Brabourne College and Other Colleges. There will be blind selection of abstracts. The final number of papers from contributors other than the host College, to be included for final publication in the volume, will be determined by the Editorial Board of Peer Reviewers. The decision of the said Editorial Board will be deemed as final.

The theme of the Journal is “Revisiting Texts and Contexts”.

Abstracts to be between 250-300 words. Final Submission of Abstracts: 18.4.24

Intimation of Approval of Abstracts: 2.5.24

Full papers to be between 3000-5000 words. Final submission of Full Papers: 15.6.24

The following Style specifications may be followed

Sanskrit: Articles may be Trilingual: Font: Baraha/ Unicode-12 – Citation System: Notes & References

Bengali: Articles to be in Bengali only: Font: Abhra Kalpurush 11- Citation System: Notes & References

Hindi: Articles to be in Hindi only: Font: KritiDev/Unicode Lipikar 12: Citation System: Notes & References

English: Articles to be in English only: Font: Times New Roman 12: Citation System: MLA 9

Persian: Articles to be Bilingual, Persian Script: Font: Times New Roman 12: Citation System: Notes & References

Urdu: Articles to be in Urdu only: Font: Urdu Type 12 Citation System: Notes & References

E mail ID for Queries, Sending of Abstracts and Full Papers: iqacjournal@ladybrabourne.com

Click Here to know more...

LADY BRABOURNE COLLEGE AND THE YOUTH WEEK PROGRAMME 2024

Lady Brabourne College, Government of West Bengal, Kolkata is committed to enthusiastic and faithful observation of Student’s Week from 2nd January 2024 to 8th January 2024. In compliance with the directive of the Higher Education Department, Govt. of West Bengal, the Principal, Prof. Siuli Sarkar has carefully marshalled her resources and deployed experts from the Faculty to coordinate and organize the events of the week. Students have shown keenness to know more about the benefits of the State Government initiative of Student Credit Card Scheme on 5.1.24. There is great anticipation at the Career Counselling Session on 2.1.24 and Digital Education on 4.1.24. All round Student Welfare as per directive is also being organized by the College including orientation and exposition of the work of the Psychological Counselling Cell on 6.1.24. A hybrid Student Welfare Session has also been planned for 7.1.24. The conclusion to the eventful week will be in terms of a vibrant Cultural Medley on 8th January. It has also been arranged that guardians will come on invitation on 3.1.24 and they will be made aware of the role of the college in imparting education and all round student welfare under the aegis of the Higher Education Department, Government of West Bengal.

Schedule

2.1.24 at 12.30 Career Counselling Session

3.1.24 at...... Guardians' meet

4.1.24 at .1.30 pm.. . Digital Education

5.1.24 at 12 noon Students' Credit card

6.1.24 at 1-2 pm Psychological Counselling

7.1.24 at 11.30 am. Students' Welfare online/offline

8.1.24 at.12 noon onwards. All competitions

NEP-CCF Orientation Program for College Teachers

Lady Brabourne College has organized an extension program for College teachers in which Sri Debasish Biswas, IC, CU will deliver a special talk on NEP on 25th July, at 11.30 am in the college auditorium. It will be followed by a lecture by Dr. Arpita Bhattacharya, Associate Professor, Department of Bengali, who will orient the teachers on the framework of NEP. Both speakers will address to all queries related to NEP from the participants. All interested teachers are welcome to attend this orientation program.

Lady Brabourne College Calendar

Curated by The Department of History

Education is a process which aids learning, acquiring knowledge and skills, develop a logical attitude towards living and enhance the potential of an individual. We in Lady Brabourne College relentlessly strive towards realizing these goals. Our students remain ‘our’ students for ever; their accomplishments become a matter of our achievements and pride. We continue to guide them, inspire them and encourage them to excel in curricular and extra-curricular activities even after they leave the precincts of our college. This calendar of the Department of History is a testimony to our endeavour to continuously motivate ‘our’ students to reach higher and higher even to the skies.

Student Achievements

Ms.Shreyasee Dutta, a student of M.Sc. (Geoinformatics) (batch 2020-2022) from LADY BRABOURNE COLLEGE, Kolkata currently pursuing her Master of Science degree in Geoinformatics from Symbiosis Institute of Geoinformatics, Symbiosis International (Deemed University), Pune has been placed in ‘Aerodyne’. This exceptional achievement of Ms.Shreyasee does not only reflect her outstanding academic brilliance but also the sacrifice of her graduate teachers in shaping her career.

The story of Ms.Shreyasee’s success will definitely encourage present students of the college to have a career in Geospatial Industries which is considered to be a field mainly dominated by students from technological background.

[ View Letter of Appreciation >> ]

The Alumni Association of Lady Brabourne College, Kolkata, has donated the amount of Rs. 3,60000/- for the renovation of the toilet blocks of Lady Brabourne College Hostel.

In case any queries/suggestion, Please contact us diksha.ugc@nic.in

Click Here to view the event: https://cutt.ly/hmDz50I

International Yoga Day is an annual event that has its roots in an Indian context, but is commemorated every year on 21 June.

The idea of International Yoga Day was conceived by Prime Minister Narendra Modi, who proposed the concept on September 27, 2014, during his speech at the UN General Assembly. The resolution to adopt June 21 as the International Yoga Day was introduced by India’s Ambassador, Ashoke Kumar Mukerji.This resolution can be viewed as a triumphant moment for Indian soft power as it received support from 177 nations, the highest number of co-sponsors for any UN Resolution.

Lady Brabourne College, Kolkata is consistently engaged in sensitizing the need for holistic health systems such as Yoga and usually celebrates the day and the system with due ceremony and respect. It plans day-long Yoga camps or invites experienced Instructors to advice on implementing the various postures in the correct manner. The Institution encourages students in the Hostel to watch relevant television programmes to motivate them.

As per the advisory issued by the UGC (with regards to the pandemic) [Ref – D.O. No. Secy (HE)/MHRD 2020, dated 4th April, 2020], the Psychological Counseling Cell of the College is continuing to function with its Online/Telephonic sessions every Monday from 3.30 pm to 5.30 pm since 11th May, 2020.

For Online Sessions contact:

Mahua Roy (Assistant Professor, Department of Sociology)

Whatsapp 9123310273

Accreditation & Other Recognition

NAAC

The College was accredited by the National Assessment and Accreditation Council in 2006, 2014 and re-accredited in 2022 with Grade - A for the 3rd consecutive term.

CPE

The College was selected as ‘College with potential for excellence’ by UGC in 2010

CPE Phase I - The College received a grant of 1 crore under CPE Phase I in 2010, which was the maximum amount to be received by any college.

CPE Phase II - The College was again selected for CPE Phase II in 2016. Under this the college received a grant of 1.5 crore which once again was the maximum amount to be received by any college. Lady Brabourne College was the only college in West Bengal to receive this honour.

RUSA

The ‘Rashtriya Uchhatar Shiksha Abhiyan’ grant was received by the College in 2015.

FIST

The college was awarded the Fund for the Improvement of Science and Technology Infrastructure (FIST) by the Department of Science & Technology, Government of India in 2010 and again in 2019

DBT-STAR College Program

The College was recognized for the DBT-STAR College Program by the Department of Biotechnology, Ministry of Science & Technology, Government of India for strengthening of UG Science in 2012 and again in 2017.

DBT Boost II

The Department of Microbiology had been selected for the BOOST II Programme (Biotechnology based Opportunities Offered to Science & Technology) in 2014 by the Department of Science & Technology and Biotechnology, Government of West Bengal for improvement of research based facility and infrastructure in Post Graduate Department of the College.

DBT Boost I

Departments of Botany, Chemistry and Zoology were selected for the BOOST I Programme (Biotechnology based Opportunities Offered to Science & Technology) in 2017 by the Department of Science & Technology and Biotechnology, Government of West Bengal for improvement of research based facility and infrastructure in these Under Graduate Departments of the College. The three departments have now started with the Post Graduate courses since 2016.

Advanced Research Centres

Post Graduate Departments of Bengali, English, Geography, Microbiology, Mathematics and Physics were given approval as Advanced Research Centres by the University of Calcutta, in 2014.

Education Excellence Award

Lady Brabourne College received the Education Excellence Award in 2018 from Zee 24 Ghanta.

College Ranking

Lady Brabourne College has been ranked 16th among all the Colleges in India and 2nd among all Colleges in West Bengal by Education World Higher Education Rankings, 2021.

Lady Brabourne College has been ranked 73rd among India's best Science Colleges, 2021 by India Today.

Lady Brabourne College, Kolkata, in collaboration with Higher Education Dept. of West Bengal, organised a 2-day national seminar on translation studies

https://www.telegraphindia.com/amp/edugraph/campus/lady-brabourne-college-kolkata-in-collaboration-with-higher-education-dept-of-west-bengal-organised-a-2-day-national-seminar-on-translation-studies/cid/1960447

The Athletic Committee of Lady Brabourne College, in association with the Uttaran Initiative from Khogaba, Maharashtra, conducted a wellness workshop - ‘Yoga - Healing through Rhythm’ on the conjecture of World Health Day and World Art Day.

The event took place in the college auditor on 12th April 2023. Four resource personnel from Uttaran conducted an interactive session on Yoga, demonstrating prananyama and meditation along with a question answer session for students. Students of the college also presented a rhythmic yoga piece to show the conjecture between art forms and wellness. The Athletic Committee also hosted a covid re-awareness programme through distribution of masks during the event.
